subject: Re: [junit] a test framework to codify levelizaton?
msgSnippet: ... Of course, all formatting seems to have been lost in translation by my html mail reader :(
messageBody:
On 19.07.2004 12:28:49, Chris Dollin <kers@...> wrote:
>>
>> Indeed. The only impenetrable bit for me is the placement of the
>> braces.... Python, anyone? :)
>
>My brace-style predates Python. (You'd probably hate my more recent
>experimental style even more
>
> public void testRemove( String findRemove, String findCheck )
> { Graph g = getGraphWith( "S P O" );
> ExtendedIterator it = g.find( Triple.create( findRemove ) );
> try
> { it.next(); it.remove();
> ExtendedIterator ut = g.find( Triple.create( findCheck )
>);
> assertFalse( ut.hasNext() ); }
> catch (UnsupportedOperationException e)
> { assertFalse( g.getCapabilities().iteratorRemoveAllowed()
>); } }
>

Of course, all formatting seems to have been lost in translation by my html mail reader :(
